name: MedicalNutritionTherapyReassessmentAndInterventionHCPCS
title: Medical Nutrition Therapy Reassessment and Intervention (HCPCS)
description: This value sets contains HCPCS codes for both individual and group medical nutrition therapy reassessment and intervention.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This value sets contains HCPCS codes for both individual and group medical nutrition therapy reassessment and intervention.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this value set is to identify patients who have participated in individual either individual or group therapy reassessments and interventions. This element may map to the "Encounter", "Assessment", or "Intervention" Category of the Quality Data Model.),(Inclusion Criteria: Includes medical nutrition therapy reassessment and interventions provided in an individual setting. Includes medical nutrition therapy reassessment and interventions provided in a group setting.),(Exclusion Criteria: Excludes initial assessment and and initial intervention.)

concept.display: Medical nutrition therapy; reassessment and subsequent intervention(s) following second referral in same year for change in diagnosis, medical condition or treatment regimen (including additional hours needed for renal disease), individual, face to face with the patient, each 15 minutes

Medical nutrition therapy, reassessment and subsequent intervention(s) following second referral in same year for change in diagnosis, medical condition, or treatment regimen (including additional hours needed for renal disease), group (2 or more individuals), each 30 minutes

contains.display: Medical nutrition therapy; reassessment and subsequent intervention(s) following second referral in same year for change in diagnosis, medical condition or treatment regimen (including additional hours needed for renal disease), individual, face to face with the patient, each 15 minutes

Medical nutrition therapy, reassessment and subsequent intervention(s) following second referral in same year for change in diagnosis, medical condition, or treatment regimen (including additional hours needed for renal disease), group (2 or more individuals), each 30 minutes
